markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Ankylosaurus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=119)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Squat, heavily armored quadrupeds, ankylosauruses are stubborn and irascible. Although they’re herbivores, they have been known to attack other creatures that trespass within territory simply out of ill temper.

 Ankylosauruses have few natural predators, as their bony hides are covered in spiked nubs that jut in many different directions to discourage larger creatures from biting them. They have mighty tails ending in an immense knot of bone, which they use to whip at threats with incredible speed and power. While these low-to-the-ground dinosaurs can trample human-sized or smaller foes, their relatively squat stance prevents them from doing so against larger targets. An ankylosaurus is about 30 feet long, 10 feet tall at the shoulder, and weighs over 3 tons.

 The ankylosaurus is the largest of the heavily armored dinosaurs called ankylosaurids, but smaller versions exist as well. Still Large in size, these smaller dinosaurs, such as the 16-foot long pinacosaurus, lack the trample ability and are rarely above 4th level. Regardless of size, ankylosaurids tend to be relatively muted in coloration, with mixes of black, brown, and gray. When captive, an ankylosaurus’s keeper might paint its scales bright colors to signify to others that is not a wild creature.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Animal](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 22

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Dinosaur_Ankylosaurus.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 6">[Ankylosaurus](/Monsters.aspx?ID=119)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="N" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Animal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=9" />
<trait label="Dinosaur" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=45" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 97</row>

**Perception** +12; low-light vision, scent (imprecise) 30 feet

**Languages**

**Skills**
[Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +17

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +7

**Dex** +0

**Con** +4

**Int** -4

**Wis** +2

**Cha** -1
</row>

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 26 

**Fort** +16 

**Ref** +10 

**Will** +12 

</row>

**HP** 90

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 25 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
tail +17 ([Backswing](/Traits.aspx?ID=173), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d8+7 bludgeoning plus punishing tail

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
foot +17 ([reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 2d6+7 bludgeoning

**Punishing Tail**   A creature struck by the anklyosaurus's tail must attempt a DC 24 Fortitude save. On a failure, it's slowed 1 until the end of its next turn; on a critical failure, it's stunned until the end of its next turn. 

**[Trample](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=39)** <actions string="Three Actions" />  Medium or smaller, foot, DC 24

</column>

<document level="2" id="creature-family-32" />
name: Ankylosaurus
